item.description:
The parking fee per car is $3 payable at a kiosk in the parking  lot near the trailhead.  You can pay with cash as the payment goes into an envelope that goes into a metal locked container.

5-24-2012

I have been researching this hike online and plan on researching it on the ground this weekend so will be adding more details soon.

5-31-12

I have hiked the trail twice now over the past Memorial weekend. Between the one relatively steep bare rock slab going up Welch and the elevation gain this hike is not for a beginning hiker who doesn't get some sort of regular exercise, therefore the question I added when you RSVP. This hike is not for you if you have been a total couch potato lately.

Getting There

  • From I-93, take Exit 28 and head east toward Waterville Valley on NH 49 (for 93N take a right at end of ramp). In 5.6 miles turn left onto Upper Mad River Road. In 0.6 mile turn right onto Orris Road, following the hiking sign for the Welch-Dickey Loop Trail. In another 0.6 mile turn right onto a gravel road to the parking area for the Welch-Dickey Loop Trail.

This is a loop hike across the summits of Welch and Dickey Mountains, providing many views along the way as the trail winds its away across open ledges. "Good views for a relatively low amount of effort."  Still this is not a hike for just any beginner hiker if they don't get some sort of regular exercise (this hike is not for couch potatoes).

Elevation gain 1650 feet (cumulative) another site said the elevation gain was 1800 feet.

These mountains are not high: Welch tops out at 2,605 feet and Dickey is slightly higher at 2,734 feet, still the total elevation gain for the first 2.5 miles of the hike is 1,650 feet..

The single-most “suggested” family hike in the White Mountains. Welch and Dickey summits command excellent views. The hike is substantial enough to give you a feeling of accomplishment, yet manageable.

There are some places where there are drop off and cliffs that you might want to keep you dog close to you if they are not cliff smart.

Definitely bring some water for both you and your dog(s) and snacks/food (lunch?) for yourself.

Links to a hiking blog of Welch-Dickey:

http://spicebush.blogspot.com/2012/04/welch-dickey-loop-trail.html

http://www.summitpost.org/welch-dickey-loop-trail/156252

http://cherylsuchors.com/hike/?tag=welch-dickey-loop-trail

A video:  http://video.nhptv.org/video/1791163855/

flicker photos: http://www.flickr.com/photos/tags/welchdickeylooptrail/

I have posted some photos as a preview of the hike in this hike's photo album. http://www.meetup.com/Manchester-Doggie-Paws/photos/8724702/
item.how_to_find_us: Once you are in the parking lot go to the far end of it. We will gather near the trail head kiosk next to the kiosk where you need to pay your parking fee.

group.name: Human Soles & Doggie Paws Hikers & Walkers of Manchester, NH

item.name: Welch-Dickey Mtn. Loop Trail - 4.4 Mile Hike - Moderate
